definition: to have a clear view (of a situation)/to fish for information/fact-finding
to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract
variant of 摹[mo2]
(equivalent to 的 as possessive particle)
background/bottom/base/end (of the month, year etc)/remnants/(math.) radix/base

sentences.english: Diagnostic test set by an English university for first year students.
sentences.chinese: 一所英國大學爲第一年學生所設的摸底測試。

sentences.english: When your car got broken into, those two officers were on a fishing expedition.
sentences.chinese: 當您的車子被竊，這兩個警察是在摸底。

sentences.english: This time we have taken measure of the U. S. armed forces.
sentences.chinese: “摸底”的幾種譯法這次我們摸了一下美國軍隊的底。

sentences.english: Departments directly under the signature by the person in charge will be thoroughly examined to do for the city in statement.
sentences.chinese: 市直各部門經負責人簽章後，將摸底表報市編辦審覈。

sentences.english: An investigation of Prunus mume planting in Beijing districts is carried out for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 首次開展了北京行政區劃內梅花栽植情況摸底調查。

sentences.english: I'm afraid you haven't a very clear idea either.

thorough search
to inspect/to run through a checklist/to take stock/to audit
to examine/to inspect

questionnaire/inventory list/CL:張|张[zhang1],份[fen4]

random inspection/to do a spot check
to tidy up/to reorganize/to consolidate/to rectify
